alert.note: Alert for Giles (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 1:45PM CST until January 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Richland Creek Above Pulaski affecting Giles County. For the Richland Creek...including Pulaski...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Richland Creek Above Pulaski. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low lying agricultural land along the river begins * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 15.7 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 1200 PM CST.
